ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Picturing my own death is a very scary thing for me - I agree with this statement:
I have thought of ways to kill myself that would be the least difficult for me to pull off - I agree with this statement:
I can tolerate pain much more than I used to - I agree with this statement:
Even if I wanted to, killing myself is too scary to follow through with it - I agree with this statement:
I have learned to overcome fear of pain - I agree with this statement:
I have considered whether some ways to kill myself would be easier than others - I agree with this statement:
I have gone through in my mind what it would be like to die - I agree with this statement:
Acquired Capability with Rehearsal for Suicide Scale (ACWRSS) Total Scale Score
Notes: Sum of 7 ACWRSS items (note acwrss_1 and acwrss_4 are reverse-scored)
Average of 7 ACWRSS items (note acwrss_1 and acwrss_4 are reverse-scored)
Sum of acwrss_1 and acwrss_4 (items are reverse-scored)
Sum of acwrss_2, acwrss_6, and acwrss_7
